alert.note: Alert for Osage; Pawnee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 16 at 3:03AM CDT until March 16 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR VERY DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST OKLAHOMA... The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon today to 7 PM CDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...IN Oklahoma, Osage, and Pawnee counties. * WIND...Southerly winds gusting in the 20 to 30 mph range. * HUMIDITY...Afternoon RH values falling into the 20 to 25 percent range. * TEMPERATURE...Unseasonably warm conditions with high temperatures in the upper 70s approaching 80 degrees. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that a dangerous combination of weather conditions and dry vegetation is expected within 24 hours, favoring rapid growth and spread of any wildfires. The primary weather factors include stronger winds, lower humidities, and warmer temperatures.
